meanings.sent1: She decided to politicalize the school event by inviting local politicians to speak.
meanings.sent2: The organization wanted to politicalize the issue to raise awareness.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to politicalize the dinner time by meowing at the politicians.
meanings.sent4: His speech politicalized the audience, making them think about the importance of voting.
meanings.sent5: The colorful posters politicalized the otherwise dull hallway, drawing attention to the upcoming election.

meanings.definition: To bring something under political control or influence.
meanings.sent1: The dictator sought to politicalize all aspects of daily life, controlling even the smallest decisions.
meanings.sent2: The company's decision to politicalize its policies led to controversy among employees.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to politicalize the fish supply, causing chaos in the Antarctic government.
meanings.sent4: The powerful lobby group politicalized the legislation, ensuring it favored their interests.
meanings.sent5: The new law aimed to politicalize the internet, regulating online content and access.
